contextId.information: The word "stand" can refer to something that does not change. AT: "remain firm in your faith" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Paul is speaking about the way others think of him and his coworkers. AT: "if people think we are crazy ... if people think we are sane" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: if we are out of our minds ... if we are in our right minds

contextId.information: "you suffered no loss because we rebuked you." This means that although the letter caused them sorrow, they eventually benefited from the letter because it led them to repentance. AT: "so that we did not harm you in any way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: you suffered no loss because of us

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "have not boasted about things over which we have no authority" or "have not boasted only about things over which we have authority." See how these words were translated in [[:en:bible:notes:2co:10:13|10:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

This is an idiom, and is exaggerated to emphasize how often he had been beaten. AT: "I have been beaten very many times" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
